page.title: 0830 Years Ago in Mickleton
page.content: Comments by Mr M Stowe,local resident. The bus service to nearby towns was much better,but people who worked out_ side the village often had cars.Trains were used more.Pebworth Halt was still in use by villagers. A lot found employment in market gardening.Few do now.Most people have to travel outside the village for work Several estates of houses have sprung up in the village.They bring in more retired people from outside the area. Mickleton had its own policeman with his bycycle,and a doctor lived in the village. Films were shown once a week in the village hall and a Youth Club met in the Band of Hope Hall(now Joseph Webb Hall).Outlying houses had earth closets and no electricity.Several orchards and many roadside trees,esp. elm,have gone.
